intro: Chorizanthe peduncularis, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish to reddish flowers.
